item.item: The FAO/WIEWS code of the institute holding the accession.
This code serves as a unique identifier for accessions within a genebank collection, and is assigned when a sample is entered into the genebank collection.
Either registered or other formal designations given to the accession. First letter uppercase.
Other identification associated with the accession

Any other identification known to exist in other collections for this accession. Use the following system: INSTCODE:ACCENUMB. When the institute is not known, the number should be preceded by a colon.

Original number assigned by the collector(s) of the sample, normally composed of the name or initials of the collector(s) followed by a number. This number is essential for identifying duplicates held in different collections.
The FAO/WIEWS code of the institute which collected the accession.
The FAO/WIEWS code of the institute responsible of breeding the accession.
Information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (i.e. parent variety in case of mutant or selection).
This type assesses the origin of the sample.
Backyard, kitchen or home garden (urban, peri-urban or rural)
Farm or cultivated habitat: backyard, kitchen or home garden (urban, peri-urban or rural).
Farm or cultivated habitat: fallow land.
Farm or cultivated habitat: farm store.
Farm or cultivated habitat: threshing floor.
Institute, Experimental station, Research organization, Genebank
Weedy, disturbed or ruderal habitat: roadside.
Weedy, disturbed or ruderal habitat: field margin.
This type assesses the biological status of the sample.
Breeding/research material: breeder's line - synthetic population.
Breeding/research material: breeder's line - Founder stock/base population.
Breeding/research material: breeder's line - inbred line.
Breeding/research material: breeder's line - segregating population.
The FAO/WIEWS code of the institute which donated the accession.
Number assigned to an accession by the donor.
Date on which the accession entered the collection.
The procedure by which the germplasm is maintained.
This type assesses the type of storage in which the sample is conserved.
This attribute holds notes regarding the sample storage.
The FAO/WIEWS code of the institute holding the accession safety duplicates.
URL linking to additional data about the accession either in the holding genebank or from another source.
The status with regards to the Multilateral System (MLS) of the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture.

The coded status of an accession with regards to the Multilateral System (MLS) of the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture. Provides the information, whether the accession is included in the MLS.
This type enumerates the different status that an accession may have in regards to the Multilateral System (MLS) of the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture.
The status with regards to the European Genebank Integrated System (AEGIS).
The coded status of an accession with regards to the European Genebank Integrated System (AEGIS). Provides the information, whether the accession is conserved for AEGIS.
This type enumerates the different status that an accession may have in regards to the European Genebank Integrated System (AEGIS).
The coded status indicating the accession availability.
This type enumerates the availability status of the accession.
